column4: I don't see how that's possible.. I reformatted the partition and still there's stuff on the drive!!
Should I sudo rm -rf /media/drive if I want to get rid of EVERYTHING on it?
Yes I'm aware of its effects
But no other method seems to be workin

OK, WTF! Seriously DOUBLEYOO TEE EFF????  sudo rm -rf /media/disk/*  admin@integrity-client01:/media/disk$ ls -a.   ._20080821 Taming the CC Beast.wav  .Trash-1002  ._.Trashes ..  .Spotlight-V100                     .Trashes
I asked a minute ago and someone said it did.. ok anyway what do I need? rm -rfa?
Lol. makes sense. thank you
Holy balls.  A whole lot of "you can't do that"
Read only filesystem. WTF
with rm .* you've just deleted the . and .. I'm not sure what will work now...
It didn't let me delete anything
sudo rm -r /media/drive/.[^.]* will delete anything on that folder in a safe way so it won't delete . and ..
No, it won't let me delete it at all. It won't let me.  it says read only filesystem.
can you tell me using a pastebin what the mount command say?
just "mount"?
http://pastebin.com/m67f8aeb7
so can you cd to your drive? i see no /media/drive
It's not /media/drive, it's /media/disk
disk-2 actually
ok, and did you managed to cd in it? and to rm -r * ?
Yes I can cd into it. But no, I cannot rm -r, that is the entire problem here.
it may be your environment or something. i just can't figure it out. sorry, is over my knowledge.
